author: mwgfelix
title: lovely little find
text:
can only re-iterate what other reviewers have said, this is location, location, location.
step out of the metro turn left and you cross one street and the hotel is only a few steps away. Plenty of bars and restaurants in the area and also a Carrefour just around the corner. We had room 35 and we could see the Eiffel tower from our window which in the night was lit up and very pretty.
the room was big enough - a small lcd television with one English channel (news), bed was comfortable and the bathroom modern, clean and tidy. the only quibble was that each guest has one hand and small bath towel each, not enough in my opinion but you only need to ask housekeeping for more. toiletries consisted of a shampoo bottle which was for the hair and body and a small bar of soap, 'They also supplied a shower cap, cotton wool wipe and bud.
Breakfast was continental with cereal, toast, jam/marmalade, croissants, cheese and hams and yoghurts.
The waitress would come around and ask if you want tea and coffee and then make it from a machine in another room - sometimes the waitress was busy or out of the room and we had to wait so it would be better if the machine was placed in the restaurant for people to help themselves.
I would definitely stay here again due to the price the location and the surrounding facilities.
Room Tip: room 35 had a view of the Eiffel tower if you opened up the window and looked to the right See more room tips
